subject: Re: call order on test methods
msgSnippet: The following technique works well for me. 1. modify the TestCase class to implements Comparator 2. add compare() and suite() routines to the TestCase as shown
messageBody:
The following technique works well for me.
1. modify the TestCase class to
implements Comparator
2. add compare() and suite() routines to the TestCase as shown below.

Hope this works for you.

Michael Giroux

---------------------------------
/**
* Construct a TestSuite with tests ordered on test name.
*
* <p>Tests that must be executed in a specified order
* should use a name convention that guarantees desired
* sort order.<br/>
* ex. test_010_name, test_020_name
*
* @return an ordered test suite
*/
public static Test suite()
{
Method[] methods = MyTest.class.getMethods();

// MyTest must implement Comparator
Arrays.sort(methods, new MyTest(""));
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
for (int i=0; i<methods.length; ++i)
{
String name = methods[i].getName();
if (name.startsWith("test"))
suite.addTest(new XALoggerTest(name));
}
return suite;
}

public int compare(Object a, Object b)
{
return ((Method)a).getName().compareTo(((Method)b).getName());
}
}
